Robotics in Art + Design

Brendan Harmon & Hye Yeon Nam
Louisiana State University

Why use robotics in art & design?

  • Algorithms can generate complex forms
  • Robots can build complex structures precisely and efficiently

Robotics in art & design enable:

  • Material differentiation
  • The emergence and expression of complexity
  • New aesthetics
  • New functionality
  • Optimization
  • Adaptability

Robotic Fabrication Techniques

  • Automated brick laying
  • Weaving tensile structures
  • Assembling timber frames
  • Constructing complex formwork
  • 3D printing metal or concrete structures
  • Automated earthmoving

A history of computational architecture

  • 1990s Blobitecture
  • 2000s Algorithmic, Generative & Parametric Design
  • 2010s Computational Construction

Greg Lynn FORM, Embryological House, 1997-2002

Autonomous Construction

Source: Snøhetta

Snøhetta, Max IV Laboratory Landscape, 2016

  • Landforms reduce ground vibrations from highway
  • Algorithmic design based on möbius strip
  • Constructed by automated GPS-controlled bulldozers
  • Balanced cut-fill
